moves.1. d4: I decided to try out the Queen's Pawn Opening.
moves.1... Nf6 2. Nf3: The Queen's pawn Game (A46). Next move does not comply with any variation of the opening.
moves.2... d5 3. Nc3 Nc6: The Development looks like the reverse four knights game.
moves.4... e6 5. Ne5: This, I think, was not the best move I could have done. Black would never move to e5 anyway! Better was 5.e3.
moves.5... Qd6: Black probably thought that his Queen was to be queened royal highness of every other piece. Black started to get trapped in his own victory road.
moves.6. Nxf7: Gave up a lingering and almost entirely useless Bishop for a rook. Best to call this breaking news article: Knight Suicided; Bishop lost.
moves.6... Qxf4 7. Nxh8 Ng4: Black calibrates my eternal weakness, f2, but luckily it is a one move fix.
moves.8. f3 Ne3: The Royal Dinner Pin coming right up.
moves.9. Qd2 Nxd4: I saw Black's threat and there's only one way to prevent it. Also note that my knight on h8 has no escape right now.
moves.10. Rc1 Qe5 11. Qd3: I wanted to get my Queen out into the field, but I have to make sure that as of right now, c2 is guarded twice
moves.11... Nef5 12. e4 c5 13. Qd1: I could have done 13.b3, but what happens in the next two moves is magically mysterious.
moves.13... dxe4 14. fxe4 Qxe4+ 15. Nxe4: Black lost his delicately place Queen after his Queen entered my knight's secret weapon, a cannon.
moves.15... b6: I don't even know why Black bothered to play this move.
moves.16. c3 Nc6: Maybe a Black Knight is just as bad in luck as a Black cat, only except that the bad luck affected his team.
moves.17... Bd7 18. O-O Ne3: This is not even close to a fork.
moves.19. Qh5+ Ke7: Why not 19...g6? 19...g6 20.Qxh7 Nxf1 21.Rxf1 and there's no doubt about the winner.
moves.20. Qf7+: The Knight that has been stuck in the pit is now being helped out of it.
moves.20... Kd8 21. Qxf8+ Be8 22. Bxc6: This was the best way to get checkmate.
moves.22... Rc8: there are many ways to mate, but I decided between two of them. One was harder to see: 23.Nf7+ Kc7 (no choice) 24.Qd6#. The other one is the easier one that I played where the White Queen and the Black King actually mate (just kidding)!
moves.23. Qd6+ Bd7 24. Qxd7#: Using all of my pieces from beginning to end helped out a lot in the process of checkmating.
